alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 4:19PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Anchorage, Matanuska Valley, Susitna Valley and Western Kenai Peninsula. This includes the cities of Anchorage, Eagle River, Indian, Eklutna, Palmer, Wasilla, Sutton, Chickaloon, Kenai, Soldotna, Homer, Cooper Landing, Talkeetna, And Willow. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A storm system will approach the region today with periods of moderate to heavy rain possible from this evening through tomorrow afternoon. Expected rainfall totals: 0.7 To 1.5 inches across the Anchorage Bowl and Matanuska Valley. 2.0 to 4.0 inches for the mountains north of Turnagain Arm and the southern Talkeetna Mountains surrounding Hatcher Pass. 1.0 to 2.8 inches across the Susitna Valley, highest amounts from Talkeetna north. 0.75 to 1.5 inches across Western Kenai Peninsula, highest amounts along the immediate coast. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along any creeks, streams, or rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action. - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
